sen.j: 澤村 宗十郎（さわむら そうじゅうろう）は、歌舞伎役者の名跡。
sen.e: Sojuro SAWAMURA was a professional name of a kabuki actor.
Sojuro SAWAMURA is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.
Sojuro SAWAMURA is a Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) actor's professional name.

sen.j: 屋号は紀伊國屋 (歌舞伎)。
sen.e: Trade name: Kinokuniya (kabuki)
The stage family name is Kinokuniya (kabuki).
The stage family name is Kinokuniya (kabuki).
Jomon (family crest) is a letter, "い", in a circle.
The Jomon (family crest) is Maru ni I no Ji (a letter, 'i' (い), in a circle).
The Jomon (family crest) is Maru ni I no Ji (a letter, 'i' (い), in a circle).

- Disciple of Chojuro SAWAMURA
A disciple of Chojuro SAWAMURA.
A disciple of Chojuro SAWAMURA.

sen.j: のちの澤村長十郎 (3代目)、助高屋高助。
sen.e: Later Chojuro SAWAMURA (the third), Takasuke SUKETAKAYA
Later Chojuro SAWAMURA (the third), Takasuke SUKETAKAYA.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: Later Chojuro SAWAMURA (the third), Takasuke SUKETAKAYA.

sen.j: 別名として沢村惣十郎とも。
sen.e: He was also known as Sojuro SAWAMURA.
He was also known as Sojuro SAWAMURA.
He was also known as Sojuro SAWAMURA.

sen.j: 初代と二代目の間に初代の弟子で宗十郎を名乗った人物がいる。
sen.e: There was a disciple of Sojuro SAWAMURA the first, who called himself Sojuro between Sojuro SAWAMURA the first and the second.
There was a disciple of the first, who called himself Sojuro between the first and the second.
There was a disciple of the first, who called himself Sojuro between the first and the second.

sen.j: 通称「遥波宗十郎」という。
sen.e: His common name was 'Sojuro YOHA'.
His common name was 'Sojuro YOHA.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を変えました。
sen.e: His common name was 'Sojuro YOHA.'

sen.j: 俳号から俗に「澤村訥子」。
sen.e: He was generally known as 'Tosshi SAWAMURA' from his haigo (pen name of a haiku poet).

tit.j: 六代目 澤村宗十郎

sen.e: - Tosshi SAWAMURA the second

sen.j: 襲名間近の名古屋での出演中に倒れるが、死後六代目宗十郎を追贈。
sen.e: He collapsed during performance on the stage in Nagoya immediately before succession to the professional name, but was donated the professional name of Sojuro SAWAMURA the sixth after his death.
He collapsed during performance on the stage in Nagoya immediately before succession to the professional name, but was donated the professional name of the sixth Sojuro after his death.
